Module hu.unipannon.virt.plot
Package hu.unipannon.virt.plot.control

Class PlotSpaceController

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.unipannon.virt.plot.control.PlotSpaceController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BarController, HBarController, LinePlotController, LogPlotController, ScatterPlotController
    public abstract class PlotSpaceController
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class provides the plot-specific control functionallity inside a Frrame. General purpose functions are implemented here, the ones varying by the Plot type are abstract.
    Author:
    Tóth Bálint
    See Also:
    FrameController

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  PlotSpaceController.LegendLocation
      Possible mounting points for the legend box specified by MATLAB.
      static class  PlotSpaceController.RefLine
      Class to store properties of reference lines.

      • setLegendLabels

        public void setLegendLabels​(java.lang.String[] labels)
        Sets the text values for the legend to display. The items given in the list appeare from top to bottom.
        Parameters:
        labels - array of label texts.

        Turn on legend display.
        Parameters:
        val - true means legend displayed.

      • setXLim

        public void setXLim​(double min,
                    double max)
        Sets the horizontal axis' bounding values. Min must be lower than max.
        Parameters:
        min - lowest point of the x axis.
        max - highest point of the x axis.

      • setYLim

        public void setYLim​(double min,
                    double max)
        Sets the vertical axis' bounding values. Min must be lower than max.
        Parameters:
        min - lowest point of the y axis.
        max - highest point of the y axis.

                        javafx.scene.paint.Paint color,

                        StrokeStyle style)
        Adds a horizontal based reference line described by the y = m*x + b equation.
        Parameters:
        m - tangent of the line.
        b - offset of the line.
        color - color of the line.
        width - width of the line in points.
        style - style of the line.
